page.title: 05LANDSCAPE AND BUILDINGS
page.content: The countryside is slightly hilly and lies between 350 and 550 feet above sea level. There are several streams which flow into the small River Ive which is in a deep valley. There is a mixture of grassland and woodland with a few fields of corn, oil seed rape and turnips. Field boundaries are mainly hedges, with some post and wire fences. Houses and farms are scattered throughout the area. There are few concentrations of buildings. The older houses are built of a greyish pink sandstone, which is the local underlying rock.
